author: AFP
title: Iranians mourn commander killed in Israeli strike - Newspaper - DAWN.COM
text: TEHRAN: Thousands massed on Thursday in the Iranian capital for the funeral of senior Revolutionary Guards commander Razi Moussavi, three days after he was killed in what Tehran says was an Israeli strike. The crowd in Tehran’s central Imam Hossein square chanted “Death to Israel” and “Death to America”. Many waved yellow flags imprinted with the message “I am your opponent” — a reference to Israel — in both Persian and Hebrew. Israel has long fought a shadow war of assassinations and sabotage against arch foe Iran and its allies, but Moussavi’s killing in Syria came at a time of sharply heightened regional tensions over the Israeli aggression against Gaza. Some of the mourners in Tehran carried pictures of Moussavi together with the revered Qasem Soleimani, a former commander of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps’s foreign operations arm who was killed in a 2020 US drone strike in Baghdad. Iran next week will mark the fourth anniversary of the death of Soleimani, who had run the IRGC’s Quds Force for more than a decade. Iranian state media says an Israeli missile strike on Monday near the Syrian capital Damascus killed Moussavi, a Quds Force general and the most senior Guards commander killed since Soleimani. The Israeli army, which has launched hundreds of strikes on Iran-linked targets in war-torn Syria in recent years, said only that it does not comment on foreign media reports. Syria on Thursday said Moussavi’s “martyrdom” on its territory was part of Israel’s “aggressive policies”, official news agency SANA reported. In letters sent by the Syrian foreign ministry, Damascus called on the United Nations to act against Israeli actions which might “ignite the region”, SANA said. Published in Dawn, December 29th, 2023

author: Jennifer Bennett
title: Hearst Units Vanquish Fired Worker’s Covid Vaccine Bias Claims
text: Two Hearst Corp. units secured a pre-trial end to a suit alleging they discriminated against a worker because of his religion and disability when he refused to get vaccinated against Covid-19 and lost his job. The fired worker’s anti-vaccine belief isn’t religious in nature, and Hearst Stations Inc. didn’t regard him as already suffering from a Covid-19 infection, the US District Court for the District of Massachusetts [said](https://www.bloomberglaw.com/public/document/RodriquevHearstCommcnsIncNo2212152RGS2024BL57908DMassFeb222024Cou?doc_id=XFFNKVF0000N) Thursday. The worker also failed to offer any evidence that co-defendant Hearst Communications Inc. employed him, the court added, granting summary judgment in both companies’ favor. Plaintiff George Rodrique II, who described ... author: Maria Vinca, Hana Mae Nassar
title: Man sentenced in North Van break-ins
text: The North Vancouver RCMP says a man has been handed a six-month sentence in connection with a series of break-ins last year. Mounties say they began an investigation after police received multiple reports between March and June of 2023. In early March of last year, officers were called to an underground parking lot, where they discovered several vehicles that had been broken into. A suspect was identified with the help of surveillance footage. In May, the RCMP received reports of a break and enter at an Edgemont Village business. A suspect was arrested with “several iPads stolen from the business,” Mounties explain. Then, just over a month later, police were called to a Marine Drive dealership parking lot for reports of a “suspicious male.” The RCMP says, in this case, several vehicles had again been broken into. A suspect was arrested in this instance as well. Police say Cole Lambert was found guilty on April 18 of this year, after being charged with two counts of break and enter and one count of theft under $5,000. He was handed six months in jail and was given credit for 69 days in custody pre-sentence.

author: BeSoccer
title: Jailson, madera brasileña para el Celta
text: Jailson, madera brasileña para el Celta [BeSoccer](https://es.besoccer.com/redactor/besoccer)hace 2 horas 1.4k Premier League Jor. 19 Liga Saudí Jor. 19 Primera División Jor. 19 LaLiga FC Futures Internacional - Invierno Cuartos Liga Portuguesa Jor. 15 João Pedro DEL DC Jack Hinshelwood MED MC Tomáš Souček MED MC Pape Sarr MED MC L. Paquetá MED MC Barcelona Primera División Tottenham Hotspur Premier League Arsenal Premier League Brighton & Hove Albion Premier League West Ham Premier League El [Real Celta](https://es.besoccer.com/equipo/celta) oficializó este jueves el fichaje del centrocampista brasileño [Jailson Marques Siqueira](https://es.besoccer.com/jugador/jailson-329208), quien ha firmado un contrato con la entidad que preside Marián Mouriño hasta el 30 de junio de 2025, con posibilidad de ampliar dicha vinculación 1 año más. El mediocentro defensivo, de 28 años, llega a Balaídos avalado por el técnico Rafa Benítez, quien ya lo dirigió durante su etapa como entrenador en el Dalian Pro de China. “Es un centrocampista versátil, agresivo sin balón, con amplia experiencia, gran despliegue físico y buen manejo de balón”, destacó el club de su primer refuerzo invernal. Jailson llega como agente libre después de finalizar su contrato con Palmeiras, con el que se proclamó campeón de la Liga Brasileña. Con el equipo de São Paulo disputó 28 encuentros, aunque solo 1 como titular. El nuevo futbolista del Real Celta cuenta con experiencia en Europa tras su paso por el Fenerbahçe. Del equipo turco dio el salto al Dalian chino, para regresar en 2022 a Brasil y unirse a Palmeiras, donde en abril de ese año sufrió una grave lesión de rodilla que le mantuvo más de medio año alejado de los campos de fútbol. [December 28, 2023]

text: NEXT STORY: Three dead after car plunges into river [Try for £1](https://www.mailsubscriptions.co.uk/products/197224/1-for-3-months-then-12.99-a-month) [Sign in] AS the glamorous actress making her formal entrance into the Royal Family, she should have been the star of the show. THE number of young people out of work due to long-term sickness has doubled since 2010. CIVIL servants have been over-promoted in a bid to get around public sector pay restraints, a think-tank has warned. A ‘HAPPINESS Unit’ backed by the Government is set to close due to funding cuts. THE BBC is feeding licence feepayers a ‘diet of woke bias’ in its original programming and news content, a campaign group has claimed. Rwanda-style scheme was considered as ‘nuclear option’ TONY Blair faced a quandary about what to do with John Prescott when he complained about not having a proper role in government, the files show. THE No10 Press Office had lost ‘all credibility’ under the combative communications chief Alastair Campbell, Tony Blair was warned. A PUBLIC inquiry after the Soham murders of schoolgirls Holly Wells and Jessica Chapman was opposed by Tony Blair, the files reveal. AN idea to use the Elgin Marbles as a ‘bargaining chip’ in London’s bid to host the 2012 Olympics was backed by Tony Blair, the files reveal. MI5 was so desperate to stop MI6 colleagues seeing the full bombshell report into how one of its agents went rogue that Margaret Thatcher limited her foreign secretary’s use of the document, the papers reveal. CHERIE Blair was ‘adamant’ her husband should sit for a portrait to be hung in London’s Lincoln’s Inn where he trained as a barrister - but it caused a headache for aides. RED Wall Tories yesterday urged Rishi Sunak to focus on cutting taxes for working families rather than slashing death duties for the better off. KEMI Badenoch has cemented her place as a front runner to succeed Rishi Sunak after she was named ‘minister of the year’ in a poll of Tory activists. author: Anonym
title: In New York, a symbolic funeral procession for a ceasefire in Gaza - The Limited Times
text:
Dressed in black, holding swaddled fake babies, hundreds of protesters took part in a symbolic funeral procession through New York's iconic avenues on Thursday to demand a ceasefire and an end to Israel's devastating bombardment of Gaza. To the sound of drums, the procession silently followed a "Ceasefire Now" banner to Times Square, one of the beating hearts of Manhattan, a neighborhood known for its giant advertising screens and popular with tourists. Demonstrators also held photos of Palestinian children who had died in Gaza.
"We want to draw attention to the fact that to date, nearly 10,000 children, if you count only children, have been killed in Gaza, because of this horrific bombing and assault, which continues unabated," said Grace Lile, a 64-year-old archivist. Since the beginning of the Israeli bombing of the Gaza Strip, following the bloody attack launched on October 7 by Hamas, New York has lived to the rhythm of actions in support of the Palestinians or Israel. These protests included Jewish Hanukkah and Catholic Christmas celebrations in the multicultural megacity of 8.5 million people.
Hundreds of demonstrators took part in a symbolic funeral procession in New York on Thursday to demand a ceasefire and an end to Israel's devastating bombardment of Gaza. CHARLY TRIBALLEAU / AFP
'The humanity of the people of Gaza' A total of 21,320 people, mostly women, children and teenagers, have been killed in Gaza since the start of Israeli military operations, according to the Hamas Health Ministry, which has ruled the Palestinian territory under Israeli blockade for 16 years. In Israel, the October 7 attack killed about 1140,250 people, most of them civilians, according to an AFP tally based on official Israeli figures. About 129 people were kidnapped by Hamas, <> of whom remain in Gaza custody.
Stephen Yankou, a 39-year-old school teacher, said he hoped "the march can speak to people and force them to face the humanity of the people of Gaza, the Palestinians, and everyone in the region, all peoples." The protesters also hope to put pressure on the US government, Israel's main ally, which has vetoed UN Security Council resolutions calling for a humanitarian "ceasefire" in Gaza.
The protesters were holding fake babies in swaddling clothes. CHARLY TRIBALLEAU / AFP
Since the beginning of the Israeli bombing of the Gaza Strip, New York has lived to the rhythm of actions in support of the Palestinians or Israel. EDUARDO MUNOZ/REUTERS
After more than two and a half months of war, nearly two million people have been displaced, or 85% of the population, according to the UN, which continues to warn of worsening "hunger and despair" in Gaza, which is totally besieged by Israel. U.S. President Joe Biden, who has been criticized by the Democrats' most left-wing supporters for his staunch support for Israel, also warned his ally of an erosion of international support because of the " indiscriminate" bombing of Gaza.

author: AFP
title: Biden dit qu'il ne graciera pas son fils, jugé coupable de détention illégale d'arme à feu | TV5MONDE - Informations
text: [Back to top](#skip-link) Le président américain Joe Biden lors d'une conférence de presse en marge du G7, le 13 juin 2024 à Savelletri, en Italie Le président américain Joe Biden a assuré jeudi qu'il ne gracierait pas son fils Hunter, jugé coupable aux Etats-Unis de détention illégale d'arme à feu, sur fond d'addiction au crack. "Non", a répondu M. Biden à la question d'un journaliste au cours d'une conférence de presse au sommet du G7 en Italie. "Je ne le gracierai pas", a-t-il ajouté, précisant qu'il ne commuerait pas non plus la peine à laquelle il sera condamné. Le démocrate, qui affrontera le 5 novembre son prédécesseur et rival républicain Donald Trump, s'était déjà engagé à ne pas gracier son fils en cas de culpabilité, assurant "respecter la procédure judiciaire". Le président américain Joe Biden et son fils Hunter Biden (d) à son arrivée à la base aérienne de New Castle, le 11 juin 2024 dans le Delaware Reconnu coupable par un jury de mensonges et de détention illégale d'un revolver en 2018, Hunter Biden, 54 ans, encourt en théorie jusqu'à 25 ans de prison mais une peine alternative pourra être aussi décidée. Cet ancien avocat et homme d'affaires, reconverti en artiste-peintre, était jugé pour avoir menti sur sa consommation de drogues lors de l'achat d'un Colt Cobra dans une armurerie le 12 octobre 2018.

author: 林妏緹
title: 冷氣團南下！各地濕冷如冬 入夜再迎一波大雨
text:
鏡新聞 冷氣團南下！各地濕冷如冬 入夜再迎一波大雨 閱讀全文 林妏緹 2025年3月5日 下午3:23 大陸冷氣團南下，華南雲雨區東移，春寒料峭雨紛飛。（資料畫面）
大陸冷氣團南下 ，各地天氣轉冷，今（6日）清晨低溫落在連江南竿8.1度、桃園楊梅10.8度。 華南雲雨區 東移，台灣中部以北、東北部及東部地區短暫陣雨，中央氣象署更針對基隆發布大雨特報，其他地區及澎湖、金門、馬祖有局部短暫陣雨，南部局部降雨。雨帶通過，上午9時、10點雨勢減緩，下半天有降雨空檔，入夜又有另一波大雨。週六（8日）水氣減少，中南部天氣回穩，北桃、東部仍有短暫雨，週日（9日）水氣再減，基隆、東部局部有雨，北桃雲多，新竹以南多雲到晴。
根據中央氣象署資料，今（6日）華南雲雨區東移，台灣海峽一帶不定時有華南雲系移入，中部以北、花東地區較易降雨，基隆北海岸有局部大雨發生，其他各地有局部短暫陣雨。氣溫方面，隨著大陸冷氣團南下，北部及東北部天氣整天濕冷，白天高溫大約15至17度，中部約20度，花東及南部21至24度，預測中部以北及東北部低溫13、14度，南部及花東16至18度，乍暖還寒，請留意氣溫變化，適時添加衣物，以免受涼；至於離島氣溫，澎湖14至16度、金門11至15度，馬祖8至10度。
週五（7日）大陸冷氣團持續發威，各地天氣偏冷；華南雲雨區東移，各地天氣濕冷，降雨機率偏高，中部以北、東北部及東部地區降雨範圍較廣泛，其他地區有局部短暫雨。
週末天氣，週六（8日）至週日（9日）清晨大陸冷氣團影響，北部及東北部天氣偏冷，其他地區早晚亦冷；迎風面的北部及東半部地區有局部短暫雨，中部山區亦有零星短暫雨，其他地區為多雲。
